BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Community Action Agency of Oklahoma City

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: "Important Community Partner" - promoting self-sufficiency and eliminating poverty in Oklahoma and Canadian Counties.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To promote the self-sufficiency of the socially, economically, and culturally disadvantaged citizens of Oklahoma and Canadian counties and to eliminate the paradox of poverty among these citizens by opening to everyone the opportunity to work; to live in decency, dignity, and worth; and to secure the opportunities needed to become fully self-sufficient.
IRS990.Desc: Head Start & Daycare - Provides full and part-time day care and preschool services with emphasis on the areas of child development, health/safety, nutrition, mental health, disabilities, family partnerships, parent involvement and literacy.1,035 children were enrolled at 22 different Head Starts. 92,703 breakfasts, 111,093 lunches and 111,093 snacks were served to students.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Community Services - Provides services to senior citizens, the homeless populace, and neighborhood needs to promote the self-sufficiency of individuals and our communities. Community Services programs include: Christmas Assistance, Graffiti Removal, RX for Oklahoma, Individual Development Accounts, Volunteer Income Tax Preparation and Neighborhood Activities.5,106 households received $878,000 in gift cards for assistance with gas, food and general household items. 1,339 households received free tax return preparation assistance. 1,435 RX clients processed.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Housing & Weatherization - Home Repair & Weatherization provides emergency home repair and energy conservation through education activities and repair services. Homebuyer Assistance provides down payment and closing cost assistance to income eligible individuals and families. Housing Counseling provided to help clients understand the responsibilities of home ownership and how to make housing and financial choices. Home Acquisition/Rehabilitation increases the availability of affordable quality homes to income eligible individuals and families. Green Home Loan program improves eligible individuals homes efficiency and reduces energy consumption. During 2022/2023 completion was being targeted on 30 roof replacements and 30 heat installations along with numerous plumbing, electrical and carpentry repairs. 330 households attended Home Buyer Education training. $216,160 was provided in down payment and closing costs assistance. 32 individuals completed one on one pre-purchase housing counseling.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Other miscellaneous income used to help defray the costs of operations.

PPP Loan Forgiveness represents loan proceeds received 05-01-2020 used for eligible purposes pursuant to the Paycheck Protection Program under the Coronavirus Aid, Relief and Economic Security Act ("Cares Act") which were formally forgiven 01-16-2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Income Tax Status CAAOKC qualifies as an organization exempt from income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and is subject to a tax on income from any unrelated business, as defined by section 509(a)(1) of the Code. CAAOKC currently has no unrelated business income. Accordingly, no provision for income taxes has been recorded.CAAOKC has adopted the recognition requirements for uncertain income tax positions as required by generally accepted accounting principles. Income tax benefits are recognized for income tax positions taken or expected to be taken in a tax return only when it is determined that the income tax position will more-likely-than-not be sustained upon examinations by taxing authorities. CAAOKC has analyzed tax positions taken for filing with the Internal Revenue Service and the State of Oklahoma. CAAOKC believes that income tax filing positions will be sustained upon examination and does not anticipate any adjustments that would result in a material adverse effect on CAAOKCs financial condition, results of operations, or cash flows, Accordingly, CAAOKC has not recorded any reserves, or related accruals for interest and penalties for uncertain income tax positions at March 31, 2023.Federal and state income tax statutes dictate that tax returns filed in any of the previous three reporting periods remain open to examination. Currently, the CAAOKC has no open examinations with the Internal Revenue Service or the Oklahoma Tax Commission.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Reimbursements to sub-recipient organization after submission of documentation demonstrating funds were expended on approved/allowable activities. Sub-recipients annual audits are monitored to ensure activity reported.

OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: Economic Development - Provides services leading to community economic enhancement and individual self-sufficiency through small business loan program, small business workshops, technical assistance, and money management training. 680 individuals received financial education training. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 5: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 6: Senior Transportation Services - Provide transportation services to senior citizens for congregate meals, senior companion services and other senior transportation needs. 7,295 seniors used our transportation services.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The form 990 is reviewed by the fiscal officer, executive director, board president, board treasurer and the fiscal advisory committee prior to filing the form. The form 990 is also presented at full board meeting.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board members sign a conflict of interest statement annually that prohibits any such activity with a board member of related business interests.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The board determines compensation of the executive director on an annual basis, based on performance, industry standards, funding, and budgets. Compensation for other employees is determined by the executive director based on program funding and budgets, and approved by board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
